englishTranslation: Listen! I don’t want you to die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mueras: die, you die (Morir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Oye! Esto es menos de lo que tenías en el barco.
englishTranslation: Hey! This is less than what you had on the boat.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: Casi moriste en el aire, tienes que tener más cuidado.
englishTranslation: You almost died in the air, you need to be more careful.
vocabIncluded: moriste: died, you died (Morir, preterite, 2nd person)
tener cuidado: "to be careful" (idiom, lit. "to have carefulness")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Esto es muy difícil, casi muere.
englishTranslation: This is very difficult, she almost dies.
vocabIncluded: muere: dies, he/she/it dies (Morir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La tercera persona en la foto no quería morir.
englishTranslation: The third person in the picture didn’t want to die.

spanishExample: Mi teléfono está muriendo, tengo que ir a casa antes de que muera.
englishTranslation: My phone is dying, I have to go home before it dies.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
muera: die, he/she/it die (Morir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Murieron al final del largo camino.
englishTranslation: They died at the end of the long path.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
murieron: died, they died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person plural)

englishTranslation: He died with more than three.
vocabIncluded: murió: died , he/she/it died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No es fácil, esta es la cuarta vez que casi mueren.
englishTranslation: It’s not easy, this is the fourth time they almost die.
vocabIncluded: mueren: die, they die (Morir, present, 3rd person plural)

englishTranslation: We didn’t die on the plane.
vocabIncluded: morimos: died, we died (Morir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No muero porque soy muy fuerte.
englishTranslation: I don’t die because I’m very strong.
vocabIncluded: muero: die, I die (Morir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quiere morir y por eso escucha con cuidado.
englishTranslation: She doesn’t want to die and that’s why she listens carefully.
vocabIncluded: escucha: listens, he/she/it listens (Escuchar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No te preocupes, no morí, estoy bien.
englishTranslation: Don’t worry, I didn’t die, I’m fine.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
morí: died, I died (Morir, preterite, 1st person)
preocuparse: any use of to worry with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to be worried)

spanishExample: Por favor no mueras, te quiero mucho.
englishTranslation: Please don’t die, I love you a lot.

spanishExample: Se parece a la segunda persona que había muerto.
englishTranslation: He looks like the second person who had died.
vocabIncluded: había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
parece: seems, he/she/it seems (Parecer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Se parece a su hermano mayor, el que murió hace un par de años.
englishTranslation: He looks like his older brother, the one that died a couple of years ago.
vocabIncluded: murió: died , he/she/it died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person)
parece: seems, he/she/it seems (Parecer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si hubiera muerto, no estaría hablando contigo.
englishTranslation: If I had died, I wouldn’t be talking with you.
vocabIncluded: estaría: "would be", "I would be" (Estar, conditional, 1st person)
hubiera: "were to have", "I were to have" (Haber, past subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Si mueres en el tren, nosotros también morimos.
englishTranslation: If you die on the train, we also die.
vocabIncluded: morimos: die, we die (Morir, present, 1st person plural)
mueres: die, you die (Morir, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Trabajo aquí y voy a trabajar aquí hasta que muera.
englishTranslation: I work here and I’m going to work here until I die.
vocabIncluded: muera: die, I die (Morir, subjunctive, 1st person)
